author: {'steamid': '76561198037001575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1457104801}
review: So I guess its my turn to give my left cross and right hook to this game or was it right cross? whatever. You play as the worlds laziest maid who is given a few tasks such as cleaning the windows and arranging flowers (something that should just take minutes) and spends hours justifying her more then generous paycheck with her her halfassed cleaning attemps all the while bittching about how she is an independent women trying to be an engineer and treating the world like it placed HER in cleaning dutys and also being stuck in a city sieged by war (wich you will never see). During the days you have the choice of chosing Clean halfassed for more then needed time and sorta halfassed cleaning for even more time, then if given enough time  you didnt waste cleaning the floors you can pay a visit to ghost chair wich will make you hillucinate over pretintious journal entries and also respond to your employers sexual harassment via sticky notes with sarcasm or cold blooded put downs. OH DEAR i did forget that you have limited mobility as well. now not having a jump buttion is not an issue for me but the ability to RUN in a game that has you pressed for time is essental as well as crouching so you can get a better look at the firewood ERR i mean books that the empoyer reads (by wich you get achievments from) TLDR was not able to get a refund sadly oh well enjoy my money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182100471', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1455390337}
review:
It pains me to say this but the game is a technical mess. After trying to see past all the issues for a good few hours I ended up requesting a refund.

It seemed like a fairly interesting game but it was almost unplayable, I have since started playing The Novelist which has a similiar concept of walking around a small lived in space over a peroid of days, that game thankfully funs like a dream. 

If all the technical issues were ironed out I'd re-buy it in an instant but sadly I'm left thinking maybe the developers of Sunset bit off more than they could chew.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049201871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1455495954}
review: I enjoyed it; I think you probably have to like either walking simulators or dating games to enjoy it, but I like both.  It's sort of an anomoly as both a walking sim and dating game.  As a walking sim, the space you move around is pretty restrictive, and as a dating game, your choices are just yes/no and the game is pretty clear about which direction you're pushing things.  Not sure why leaving all the lights on is super-romantic, though.  The apartment you walk around is pretty nice and the use of lighting is really good.  I recommend it if you like walking sims in a nice/evocative enivronment with sort of a dating game thrown in on the side.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998645347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1456013933}
review: I really enjoyed the rich story and character devlopment in this walking simulator; its strength is revealed while exploring the environment and discovering the world the characters live in. Players will experience relaxed stroytelling, a compelling backstory, and memorable character content as they progress through.  The game began to drag for me towards the end as the number of days documented by the main character felt excessive -- I thought there were several good/possible endings before reaching the actual end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996816228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1455376370}
review:
A touching story about the impact of war on the lives of ordinary people, marred by incredibly humdrum gameplay.

For what it is, the game is way too much money. I enjoyed it, but I'd only reccommend the game to people who are really, really in to games with very little interaction e.g Gone Home.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974021377', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1455161137}
review: This is the stupidest game I have ever played. I'm sure there is something worse than this out in the ether, but I haven't played it. At least Superman 64 let you fly around. Nobody wants to buy a game where you clean the floor, we have reality for that, we play games to escape from our real lives and do things we can't do normally. Go on big epic adventures. Enjoy a well crafted story. Or just experiment with the mechanics. It's supposed to be about fantasy, and entertainment. Why was it surprising to them that nobody liked this? Then the developer berated the community and said we didn't want to buy your game because we were all horrible people. This is so bad. I played this for 15 minutes, I'll probably never play it again. You just sit around cleaning the house, then you go to the next level and clean the house again. I'm supposed to empathise with this character, but you made a gross miscalculation. I don't. I hate this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993349383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1451871545}
review:
Really strong premise, and a bold subject, but sadly the mechanics really seem to fall short of what the game seems to be trying to do. 

There simply isn't enough to do in the game. You find the objects that you can click on in the apartment, and decide to do A or B, with the knowledge that you will A: increase romance, or B: increase neutrality. For a game trying to handle political upheval and socioeconomic injustices between classes and nations, this really isn't enough. There's a little to explore in the environment to drive the narrative deeper, there are a few events that occur, but overall it just comes off empty. 

If the goal was to create a sense of absraction from the outside world, an isolation from real life in a penhouse stronghold, then the monologuing from the player character throws it off, being too rightous and full of revolutionary potential. And the romance throws this whole potential narrative out of whack. 

If the goal was to show the potential for one person to make a difference, for the individual lives of disperate groups to intertwine, then the lack of gameplay choices really suffocates this narrative. And the monologuing again has a tendency to not fit, throwing revolutionary ideals around while you post cutesy notes around. 

It's a powerful game for about half an hour, or until the first instance of violence happens. After that, it's pretty lame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970952580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1553347514}
review:
Tale of Talesの「THE PATH」が好きだった人ならこのゲームも好きになると思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198024945492', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1454186091}
review:
I am amazed by the positive media reception. The game drops tons of frames on my decent mashine, the storytelling is very boring (even preachy) on almost every day and the chose your own adventure parts seem rather random. 

Music and Voice Acting are good. But compared to other games like "gone home" this just dos to little.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994280558', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1453759587}
review:
C'est dans l'ADN même des "Walking Simulators" que d'être un peu exigeants : ils nous jettent, bien souvent sans une once d'introduction, en plein milieu d'un univers et attendent de nous qu'on se prenne en main, seuls, comme des grands. Ils tracent les grandes lignes d'une aventure, nous laissant le soin d'en remplir les blancs comme bon nous semble... Lorsque les mécaniques de jeu sont agréables et bien pensées, il arrive qu'on touche au sublime. Corollaire malheureux : lorsqu'elles sont bancales, il ne reste plus grand chose pour sauver le jeu...

Pas de chance, Sunset entre dans cette deuxième catégorie :( Le système de sélection des actions est tout particulièrement mal pensé et oblige quasi-systématiquement à des micro-déplacements pour sélectionner l'option désirée. Qu'à celà ne tienne, si l'histoire est prenante, c'est l'assurance de passer un bon moment malgré tout ! Malheureusement encore, celle de Sunset est tout sauf inspirée... On peine à comprendre exactement ce qui se passe, l'héroïne nous livre son lot de commentaires dont on ignore régulièrement d'où ils viennent (Ai-je loupé quelque chose ? Pas cherché assez ? Raconte-t-elle ce qui se passe entre chaque visite de l'appartement ?) et la relation entre Angela et son employeur est vraiment plus que guidée (j'ai systématiquement choisi l'option "sérieuse" et évité tout flirt, visiblement sans impact aucun sur l'histoire).

Bref, Sunset entre tambour battant dans la liste des jeux que j'aurais adoré aimer, mais que je m'efforcerai malheureusement d'oublier bien vite...

author: {'steamid': '76561198023354627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1453411483}
review:
Sunset - это очень камерная, "закрытая" игра о гражданской войне с довольно необычной и непривычной перспективой развития событий. Играя за домохозяку, придется наблюдать за развитием конфликта и при этом даже принимать в нем косвенное участие. Готовя, убираясь и стирая, главная героиня Анжела постепенно погружается в пучину не только заговоров, подготовки к военным действиям, но так же и отношений (с работодателем, между прочим), ненависти к правительству и рассуждениям о режиме и том, что всех ждет в ближайшие месяцы. И это создает интересный контраст - повествование ведется не от лица солдафона, революционера и пр., а от лица простой домработницы. Этим она и интересна.
Другое дело, что порой игра все же дает заскучать, т.к. какой-то постановки и особых страстей здесь ждать все же не стоит - размах не тот. Да и локация в игре, как-никак, одна - по понятным причинам. 
Да и с технической стороны все не очень гладко - фризы и провисания будут сопровождать до последнего. Не то чтобы это отвлекало от главного, но все-равно неприятно.
И все же, Sunset довольно любопытный проект, даром что его авторы - Tale of Tales - мастера создавать подобного рода  игры. Только на этот раз Tale of Tales решили сменить курс - у них вышла самая человечная и простая в понимании история из всех, что они воплотили в жизнь. Это их и погубило. Коммерческого успеха игра не достигла и авторы попрощались с индустрией.
Таким образом, Sunset - это лебединая песня Tale of Tales в игровой индустрии. И не самая плохая, надо сказать, песня.

-----------------------------------------------------------

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093933654', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1453258790}

But this game doesnt run.  no one optimized it.  Art should be first and foremost accesaible, and this is just a pain in the ass

author: {'steamid': '76561197970546442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1451973180}
review:
ถ้าหากว่าเกมในสไตล์ Narrative-Based เน้นการอ่านเอาเรื่องราวมากกว่าระบบการเล่นคือของแสลงอย่างถึงที่สุดสำหรับแวดวงแล้วนั้น Sunset ก็คืออีกหนึ่งหลักฐานสำคัญ ที่บ่งบอกถึงความสับสนในแนวทางดังกล่าว แม้จะมีแก่นกลางและประเด็นที่น่าสนใจมากเพียงใดก็ตาม 

Tale of Tales ทีมพัฒนาสายเบลเยียมยังคงชัดเจนในวิถีสาย Video Game Art ของตนเองอย่างเหนียวแน่นเช่นเดียวกับผลงานก่อนหน้าอย่าง The Path และ Fatale ต่างกันตรงที่ Sunset นั้น บอกเล่าด้วยน้ำเสียงที่เจือการบีบบังคับ และการ Narrative อย่างชวนอึดอัด ในชีวิตและความสัมพันธ์อันยากจะอธิบายของ Angela Burnes แม่บ้านสาวผิวสีชาวอเมริกัน และ Gabriel Ortega นายจ้างหนุ่มใหญ่ที่เธอไม่เคยพบหน้า ในควันไฟสงครามกลางเมืองแห่ง Anchuria ประเทศสารขัณฑ์อเมริกาใต้ 

ในแง่นี้ ความเปลี่ยวเหงา ความไม่แน่ใจ และการพัฒนาความสัมพันธ์ระหว่างตัวละครทั้งสอง แม้จะมีเป้าหมายที่ชัดเจน แต่ก็ดูจะติดขัดและกระชากออกไปสู่สิ่งที่ทำให้สะดุดทางอารมณ์อย่างรุนแรงในหลายต่อหลายครั้ง ซึ่งเป็นสิ่งที่ยากจะมองข้าม เมื่อเกมแนว Narrative ความลื่นไหลคือหัวใจหลักสำคัญ ไม่นับรวมปัญหาทางเทคนิคปลีกย่อยอีกเล็กๆ น้อยๆ ที่ไม่ร้ายแรงแต่ก็มากพอจนเป็นที่สังเกตได้ 

โดยส่วนตัว ผมชอบเกมนี้ ชอบประเด็นที่มันอยากจะนำเสนอ และอารมณ์ความเหงาราวกับจะ 'กระทำความหว่อง' ผสมโลกร้าวๆ จากนิยายของมุราคามิ แต่ก็เป็นอีกหนึ่งเกมที่ไม่อาจจะเอ่ยปากแนะนำให้หามาลองเล่นกันอย่างพร้อมน้อมใจ มันขึ้นกับคุณ ว่ามองเกมแนวนี้ เป็นวรรณกรรม เป็นความแปลกใหม่.... หรือเป็นยาขมกันแน่

author: {'steamid': '76561198032087697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1451664344}
review: Don't listen to any nay-sayers negatively reviewing this game that don't have at least 7 hours on record (the amount of time for a decent playthrough in my opinion). If you like Gone Home or similar walking narratives, this game is for you. If you don't like these kinds of games, why are you playing/reviewing this in the first place? Anyway, I highly recommend this.  Short and sweet. Play it for yourself and you'll see why. Quick Tip: Try to write in your journal every day. It really enhances the experience. You'll know what I mean once you start playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982462897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1451171853}
review: An obscenely good game with beatiful atmosphere and a slow, powerful story. If you can appreciate writing that takes its time, speaks in metaphors, and offers more complex questions than easy answers, Sunset might blow you away the way it did me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069634986', 'num_games_owned': 3362, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1476030680}
review:
[b]Sunset[/b] is an interesting walking simulator indie adventure with charming graphics and an interesting story.
If this review is too long for you, I suggest you to only read the first paragraph about the game's content and the final verdict at the end.

[h1]What is happening in the game:[/h1]
You are Angela Burnes, a housekeeper. You are trapped in a beautiful city that was turned into a warzone. Every week, you have to clean some rich man's house. You have certain tasks to do, but the main thing is to discover other things in his house which lead to a surprising story.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Concept of the Game[/b] | The thing I like the most about this game is its ... [i]interestingness[/i]. Yes, this is a word. At the beginning of this review, you can see that this game is a walking simulator. Ergo, this game is not for everybody. I understand the disappointment of some people, but this game requires your absolute attention and taking your time to play. And this is what I appreciate it for.
    [*][b]Visuals[/b] | So, this game looks really nice. I admit, the colours may seem a bit unusual, but you'll get used quickly to the feeling that the surroundings give you.
    [*][b]The Sounds[/b] | [i][b]NOTE: I'm not talking about the soundtrack[/b][/i] | The sounds are pretty good in my opinion, however, this game doesn't really have a constant soundtrack (see cons). I like how you can actually hear footsteps and there are also some outside noises.
    [*][b]Achievements[/b] | There are a hundred achievements and they all reward you for paying close attention to the game. Just by doing regular task as you're supposed to, you're not gonna get many. It's a nice way to make a player play the game! It seems bugged in some cases, though, I didn't even realise there are achievements in the first playthrough but after clearing my data, the achievements were working again. I might be alone in this as none of my friends I asked were having the same issues.
    [*][b]Amount of Available Gameplay[/b] | The shortest time you can spend to complete the game is supposedly an hour and a half, but if you are willing to spend time on it, you can get hours and hours more. A similar system was used in Life is Strange, which you could beat in 12 hours or 20, if you took your time.
    [*][b]OS and Steam Integration[/b] | Sunset includes MacOS and SteamOS support and gives you Achievements and Trading cards for playing.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Steam Controller Support[/b] | I had bad issues trying to play with my recently acquired Steam Controller. The touchpad sensitivity is pretty much nil and I had to swipe multiple times to turn around for a really small angle. The sensitivity slider in the options menu barely helped. I just played with my keyboard and enjoyed the game, probably more than I would with a controller.
    [*][b]The Soundtrack[/b] | Although I like the sound effect quite a lot, I am disappointed in the lack of a proper soundtrack. A calm loop song would fit into the game really nicely and I would spend much more time in this game. I mean, there are a few songs here and there, but it's not always present. Also, there is an OST DLC available for 4$. What does it include? No idea.
    [*][b]Pricing[/b] | 20$? How about no? As much as I enjoyed this game, it's [i]not[/i] worth that much money. 20$ is a fair price for Rocket League or CS:GO, but this games just lacks in content to justify that price. I'm not even sure in 10$. Sorry.
[/list]

[h1]The final verdict:[/h1]
A nice, yet heavily overpriced walking simulator. I really enjoyed playing it and I could probably even get a few more hours of gameplay out of it. It gets slightly repetitive over time, but I mostly liked Sunset for the experience and the feeling. This being said, Sunset is not a game for everybody. If you like slow-paced walking simulator adventures, this might be for you. If you don't, go check out some other games.

Greetings,
BirdCute

[quote]Note that my copy of this game was obtained for free for reviewing purposes. However, this did not affect the quality and objectivity of this review.[/quote]

[i]---

author: {'steamid': '76561198062227881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1441838522}

author: {'steamid': '76561198195981266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1447196350}
review:
When you reach the end of the game it is really beautiful to see how far video games have come.  I feel like this game would have been perfect for 2002 when we were insecure about video games being a high art form.  Art is all about timing and today we just don't need a video game that is so dedicated to art that isn't traditionally fun.  Video games as art is working out just fine.  Games like The Last Of Us are combining art with reliably fun concepts.  We can have fun, beauty, depth.  We don't have to choose between the three anymore.  

I really feel for the developers who rage quit when the game was critically panned.  A lot of people didn't really play the game and judged it too quickly as soon as they clicked on a chore.  It actually turns out there is fun to be had by establishing a routine for the main character and disrupting it by having a war happen all around you.  There is fun to be had through the immersion.  People didn't always give this game a fair chance and I apologize for them.

I must admit the major flaw of the game comes up immediately.  The narration.  It's kind of like the mostly unnecessary narration in Grey's Anatomy.  The way Sunset is designed the story has to be told to the player.  The actress just wasn't able to put on a convincing performance.  I found myself enjoying the immersion instead of the narration.  Great acting could have gone a long way in this game.  

Recommended.  See for yourself how far games have come.  Admire how much effort was put into a concept that is no longer workable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001352987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1435195765}
review: This game was a wonderful experience.  Honestly, I could spend an afternoon just turning on the music and wandering around the apartment by myself.  I loved the feeling that there was a world going on outside, although I wished they'd done a little more to hide the sparseness of what was created outside of the apartment—just make it so I can't look down and see there are no streets! :)  But the sounds make up for it.  The story progression provided by subtle changes throughout the apartment is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036185338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1449570548}
review:
„Spiel“ ist nicht die richtige Bezeichnung für Sunset, eher erinnert es mich an die Bücher, die einen immer wieder vor Entscheidungen stellen und je nach dem, wie man handelt ändert sich der weitere Verlauf der Geschichte, ohne dass es immer direkte, kausale Zusammenhänge gibt. Ein Kammerspiel mit einer Person auf der Bühne – Angela, deren Rolle man übernimmt – und diversen Charakteren, die das Leben und den Fortgang der Dinge in der mittelamerikanischen Republik Anchuria prägen. Angela, obwohl nur Putzfrau in einem luxeriösen Penthouse, steckt auf einmal mitten in der großen Politik. Unterstützt sie ihren Bruder, der zu den Rebellen gehört? Wie verhält sie sich zu dem geheimnisvollen Wohnungsinhaber, Señor Ortega, mit dem sie nur über Zettel kommuniziert?
Eine höchst atmosphärisch erzählte Geschichte mit liebevoll ausgestatten Details, einem anrührenden Soundtrack und einer spannenden Geschichte. Obwohl das Penthouse isoliert über den Dächern der Hauptstadt schwebt, vermittelt sich doch ein Eindruck einer Gesellschaft, eines Individuums inmitten einer Umbruchsituation und den ambivalenten Entscheidungen, denen man sich stellen muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026071346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1451681951}
review: Ein Ruihges Spiel, eigene Handlung steht nicht im Vordergrund, die Erzählung ist hier klar im Vordergrund. Trotzdem ist die Handlung der Protagonisten gut mit der Gschichte verküpft. Update folgt, sobald ich das Spiel durch habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163831675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1449445539}
review: Une vraie claque narrative!! Loin des triples A modernes, ce jeu m'a transporté, inquiété, oppressé, emmerveillé comme jamais !! Un succès commercial moyen pour un jeu qui sort réellement du lot et que je considère comme l'un de mes GoTY 2015 :) Férus de point&click et d'histoires humaines n'hésitez pas à le prendre... En soldes. Un peu cher malgré la qualité mais court tout de même. Peut importe c'est intense !

author: {'steamid': '76561198066371584', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1450161355}
review:
Очень неоднозначная игра, но все же я ее рекомендую. 
Во время игры я постоянно испытывала очень противоречивые чувства (об этом ниже), но все же до самого финала было сильное желание возвращаться снова и снова, забыв на время про остальные игры.

Начну с самого главного для меня минуса, то есть с главной героини. Для меня она оказалась крайне неприятным человеком уже после первого часа игры. Почему сложилось такое впечатление? Отвечу: во всей ее речи, в записях дневника, сквозит злоба и самодовольство. Ее мысли скучны и посредственны, и лишь изредка проскальзывает что-то интересное, но потом снова начинается (уж извините) нытье про ущемления, неравноправие, богатство хозяина пентхауса (даже когда у них появилась симпатия друг к другу!). Я не говорю, что некоторые ее слова про неравенство не имеют по собой реальной основы. Но как она это постоянно говорит... Если кто помнит ее реплику про то, что телевидение придумали белые (потому что темнокожих на черно-белом экране практически не видно), то я говорю именно об этом. Не знаю, может меня одну зацепили ее бесконечные тирады о несправедливости жизни. В общем. Я не знаю зачем было делать именно такую героиню, но для меня она - главный минус. Кстати, именно поэтому я также не оценила идею с дневниковыми записями. За всю игру у меня собралось только две, и причина тому - в них то же самое слабоволие и злоба. 

Теперь о том, почему же все-таки игра мне скорее понравилась. Первое: все же большую часть времени главная героиня молчит. И это помогло абстрагироваться от ее личности и бродить по дому и выполнять поручения от своего собственного лица. 
Музыка является одной из составляющих атмосферы. Ее крайне мало в игре, и именно поэтому она так ценна. Композиции лично мне ранее не были известны, что тоже замечательно.
Графика в игре замечательная. Конечно же я не про техническую составляющую, с этим все скромно. Но дизайн пентхауса и игра со светом делают свое дело. Освещение меняется в зависимости от погоды и времени суток, и это тоже задает настроение. 
Сюжет... мне очень сложно говорить об этой части игры, хотя по идее она - самая важная ее часть. Но мне практически нечего отметить. Да, история. Война, брат, взрывы у порога... Но почему-то это не цепляет. Ты бродишь по дому в поисках чего-то, что раскроет личность хозяина, и следишь больше за человеческими отношениями, а не за политическими. Подозреваю, что создатели игры добивались не такого, но, к сожалению (?) у меня было именно так. Мне было интереснее слушать пластинки, читать записки, смотреть на картины и разбирать документы, чем слушать Анжелу и переживать за ее брата и за страну.

В заключение: игра однозначно интересная. И попробовать стоит, хотя есть большая вероятность, что будет скучно уже через 30 минут. У меня же впечатление в процессе было очень неоднородным, но после финала и еще нескольких дней спустя я понимаю точно: игра что-то приятное и теплое после себя оставляет. И это то, что я в принципе и ищу в играх.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973885494', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1673898430}
review: A great work. This is not a tipical game, but an experience that use the videogames engine. I think that ToT team is doing something that in the future others will do. Sunset is another experiment at the edge of videogames world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097670907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1448678902}
review:
I enjoyed this game. I really liked the premise of watching the world from your hour of time to clean a man's apartment. I also liked how your actions could affect your relationship with him, even though you don't meet him at all.

I did find it strange that turning a faucet on or off would affect the relationship one one or another (one way for on and one way for off), but everything else I understood. It was really difficult to find the tasks you were supposed to do sometimes, so I suggest looking at everything thoroughly every day, no matter what the tasks are. 

While a bit overly dramatic at times, this game was a quick play through and I did enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044289727', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1433443280}
review:
Sunset от Tale of Tales я ждала с большим нетерпением.  Настолько в свое время меня поразили The Path и Graveyard, что   уже до выхода Sunset я была уверена, что куплю игру. Купила. Через час вернула деньги обратно.
Что же меня разочаровало? Пробегусь сначала по плюсам:
1) Сеттинг. Вымышленная латиноамериканская страна, неспокойные времена и мурлычащая что-то себе под нос темнокожая домработница. Перед её глазами развернется вся картина происходящего, а сама она останется невредимой - так можно не то, что игру, а целую книгу написать!
2) Визуальная составляющая. Tale of Tales умеют делать красивые картинки, тут не поспоришь.
3) Отдельно хочется выделить креативное оформление меню в виде контрольной панели лифта.

А теперь о минусах:
1) Несмотря на красивый сеттинг, всё происходящее подается очень сумбурно. Если вновь провести аналогию с книгой, то представьте себе, что каждые 10-15 страниц автор просто выкидывает, а произошедшее пересказывает в 2-3 скупых предложениях. Додумывайте сами, времени вжиться в сюжет у вас нет.
2) Нудный геймплей. Разумеется, от игры про домработницу нельзя ожидать особого экшена, но из-за ограничения по времени (до заката) и из-за скачков из одного дня в другой не создается медитативной атмосферы, свойственной предыдущим, более размеренным творениям Tale of Tales. А без этой атмосферы однообразные действия, повторяемые раз за разом, просто начинают раздражать.

Вердикт: хотите получить представление об игре? Посмотрите трейлер. В нем пересказано все самое лучшее, и как ни печально это признавать, но творения Tale of Tales настолько далеко ушли от мейнстрима, что уже далеко не всем под силу проникнуться ими и пропустить через себя.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025834631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1446667034}
review: Beautiful, mellow gameplay. Focus is on story and aesthetics. I like to play this game in place of watching a show. Interactive story time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995714767', 'num_games_owned': 2315, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1442852665}
review:
If you like interactive fiction, Sunset is a solid game to play with a few caveats.  It can be a little boring to actually play through, as you're essentially doing the same thing each chapter (finding things to click on), though each chapter plays out differently.   However, the story advances nicely and is pretty unique and interesting, and there is an element of exploration as you try to find notes/books/tasks.  

I did find myself invested in the story and I actually cared about the choices I made throughout the Sunset.  The basic idea behind the game is clever, to experience a governmental coup through the eyes of a citizen/maid and her connection to someone close to the government, but I think more could have been done with the game's mechanics.  Still, I recommend playing Sunset, I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113074241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1442674091}
review:
Последняя игра компании Tale of Tales, которая всегда отличалась неодинарными и своеобразными сюжетами. Sunset та игра - где вы будете "понимать", как сможете, ибо она мини загадка и для более узкой аудитории.

Я давно ждала выхода этой игры и конечно ожидала немного большего, но пройдя Sunset у меня осталось скорее всего больше вопросов, чем ответов.

✒ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ✒

Сюжет игры происходит в вымышленной стране под названием Анчурия, там где совершился военный переворот, приведшей к военной диктатуре!Мы играем за темнокожую девушку по имени Анджела Бернс, по совместительству феминистку, а ныне домработницу-шпионку, работающей в роскошном и дорогом пентхаусе местного богача Габриэля Ортеги и все, то время, что ей придеться пережить, начиная от романа с собственным начальником до косвенного участия в восстании против нынешнего правительства. Все время мы будем наблюдать со стороны. В город тут не выйдешь Многое заключается в том, что нужно выполнять задания мистера Оргего и постепенно, раскрывая его жизнь и секреты. Концовок тут конкретно нет, но в конце игры мы проснемся, в голубом расвете, и последнее пребывание в полуразрушенном особняке успеем не только выспаться, но и насладимся последней чашечкой кофе в пентхаусе Ортеги.

★Плюсы★: 

-Приятная графика и цветовая гамма игры 
-Расслабляющая атмосфера
-Оригинальность и непохожесть данного меню
-Неплохая, но с одной стороны с романтическим, скорбным и грустным мотивом латиноамериканская музыка
-Введение дневника и благодаря ему можем не малое узнать, что чувствует наша героиня
-В одной из миссий Анджела может написать свою песню и колбаситься по ней :)

＊Минусы＊:

-Повторяющиеся миссии по типу: убрать, приготовить, сложить
-Время по странному ограничено, солнце заходит бегом домой
-Неудобство с предметами, так как не получается взять или выпонить действие с первого, а то и со второго раза
-В некоторые дни недоступны многие комнаты, даже спальня
-Багованность в выполнении заданий(Не всегда понятно, когда ты все выполнил)
-Кроме Анджелы в доме мы не увидим никого, а болтаем будто с записочками, которые оставляет нам Ортега.
-Графика немного сливается, во время ходьбы

☂Оценки☂:

Сюжет: 7/10
Геймплей: 6/10
Графика: 8/10
Музыка: 8/10

Общая оценка игры 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055621770', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1434459812}
review:
Seemed like an interesting concept at first, and I loved the aesthetic, so I bought it.
Couldn't get it to run at all.
Watched a playthrough, and it's honestly one of the most dull games I've ever seen.
The main protagonist is terrible to listen to, and there aren't even any animations for any of the work you do.
This game could have the most interesting story, but there's nothing to keep me engaged to get to that point.

And you're asking for $20? Wow. I'm glad I got it in a bundle and didn't have to pay more than a dollar or two. I would be pissed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000805128', 'num_games_owned': 9352, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1442093697}
review:
This game is really REALLY boring. You play as a maid who cleans your client's appartment, but all you do is left-click the chore and it just happens. The instant left clicks could have been replaced with smaller minigames and this would have been a much better experience.

Of my 4.8 hours, 3.6 were afking for cards and the other 1.2 were me actually playing. If you do want to play a good cleaning simulator game, please look into the Viscera Cleanup Detail series. It's a good thing I got this in a Humble Bundle or else I would have refunded this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049686853', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1445557002}
review: Just walking around doing nothing while the plot takes 5 years for it to move ahead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990775928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1433047793}
review:
Finally, an understandable game from ToT! :)

If you like "slice of life" simulators, then you should really like this game. It has exploration, decent pacing, and a story that invokes some serious thought. And as you complete tasks and develop a relationship, you get a nice sense of accomplishment.

Note there may be just a tad anti-America sentiment in here, but it fits the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012594581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1460323553}
review: This is right up my alley. I loved the setting, the atmosphere, the music, and the entire visual persentation. True to its name, it generates a warm and exotic feeling in me. I'll be thinking of it long after I've finished it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981867244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1441127754}
review:
This game is a trainwreck. I wanted to like this, I thought it was supposed to be a good, artsy game. Instead, its a cynical cash in. The writing is atrocious, and the game didn't even get a copy-edit. The voice acting sounds phoned-in half the time. Game is set in the fictional world of South Amerca, in fictional 1972. Why would you set a story in a real continent and year but not use real events or country names?

Sunset tries to be Gone Home, but the exploration is so underwhelming and it pretty much plays itelf. There's no real game here, as 'cleaning the floor', for example, means clicking the broom once and watch time tick past. Story items are only explained a little bit, one sentence or two for each, and the character you play as doesn't even need to see items to comment on them the next day. You get achievements for looking at the books scattered around the house each day, but why should I care if this guy reads Brave New World? You look at Life is Strange, and they tell you why the pop culture it references is worth looking into. Sunset's just like 'here's a book one of the devs likes'.

I don't know if the people who made this have ever done anything physically before in their lives, but, I'm sorry, a young woman isn't going to assemble a 500 pound mobile scuplture suspended 20 feet in the air with no tools and no ladder. What were they thinking? The only thing that I got any sort of kick out of was the space station chairs from 2001 A Space Odessy, and man is that a random thing to add.

The game bombards you with trite poetry, rife with spelling errors and ridiculous statements like 'fire, a symbol of comfort.. and destruction'. Really? The color pallet in the house is more abstract and less on-the-nose than the writing. And then, in the story, they just randomly introduce elements into the mythos. I decoded a document because I was snooping around, and so for whatever reason I now have a brother who's a resistance leader. Why didn't we mention anything about this before it was of major relevance to the 'plot'? There's absolutely no incentive to explore the game's story, anyway. And the character doesn't even know herself. She's black, so obviously she would refer to her own school as 'the black school', right? Riiight.


Oh, and the game performs horribly on my machine. They even have a setting where you can reduce the graphics to look like Journeyman Project (1992). I kid you not, the lowest graphics setting looks like the Sega CD and it still runs like garbage. And why do the carpets at the begining look like snow, even in the advertised screenshots, but in the sunset 'levels' the rugs are gone?

Stay away from this boring, unthoughtful title. The developers obviously wanted to have as little to do with it as possible, too. I'd just like to thank them for dispanding before they had a chance to make a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006049410', 'num_games_owned': 3505, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1452803210}
review:
Ein faszinierendes Projekt, beschädigt durch den Versuch, ein Spiel zu sein.
Die im Lauf des Spiels zunehmende Distanz zwischen Gameplay und den sich durch die Entscheidungen des Spielers verändernden zwei Geschichten des Spiels (der im Hintergrund stattfindenden Revolution und der Beziehung der zwei Hauptfiguren) führte (für mich) zu zunehmender Irritation mit dem Spiel und untergrub die Glaubwürdigkeit der Figuren.
Dieses Phänomen nennt sich seit einigen Jahren "Ludonarrative Dissonanz" und Sunset ist ein perfekter Vertreter dieses Problems. Auslöser dafür ist hier die Weigerung, das minimalistische Gameplay an die veränderte Situation der Figuren anzupassen. Zu Beginn macht die Beschränkung auf "eine Stunde Zeit zum putzen" und "Ausführen der Aufträge entweder einfach effizient oder mit persönlichem Touch" durchaus Sinn, doch wenn man etwa der Liebesgeschichte folgt und eingeladen wird, während der monatelangen Abwesenheit des Wohnungsbesitzers soviel Zeit in der Wohnung zu verbringen, wie man will, wirkt es irritierend, dass das "Eine Stunde"-Limit weiter aufrecht erhalten wird.
Denn wieso sollte Angela, die zu diesem Zeitpunkt offensichtlich (erwiderte) Gefühle für Gabriel Ortega hat und mehrfach geäußert hat, dass sie sich in dieser Wohnung (großteils zurecht) wohl und sicher fühlt, sich weiter an diese Regel halten und pünktlich um 1800 hinaus rennen in diese Stadt während einer Revolution, erschüttert von Gewehrfeuer und Explosionen? Schlimmer noch...warum sollte dieses Liebespaar, nachdem er von seiner Odyssee zurück kommt, die dem Spiel zugrunde liegende Distanz künstlich weiter aufrecht erhalten, indem Angela weiter nur vorbei kommt, während Gabriel nicht zu Hause ist? Was soll das?
Seltsamer wird das ganze übrigens noch dadurch, dass das Gameplay sich selbst untergräbt, indem darauf bestanden wird, dass keine Reinigungsaufträge zweimal auftauchen. Es wirkt zunehmend absurd, dass der Boden der Wohnung nur einmal im kompletten Spiel gereinigt wird, aber Angela stattdessen in 15min eine 10m lange Wand mit der hässlichsten Tapete aller Zeiten beklebt oder nur eine von zwei Statuen reinigt oder später rettet, weil eine die neutrale, die andere die "romantische" Option war. Was zur Hölle soll das? 
Ganz ehrlich, ich will dieses Spiel empfehlen können und ich will dieses Spiel lieben für seinen Versuch, etwas neues zu machen und zu erzählen...aber so sehr ich es auch genossen habe, die Wohnung bei jedem Besuch erneut erforschen zu können und die Handlung mitzuverfolgen...so sehr hat es mich auch genervt, wie sehr dieses Spiel an die Grenzen seines rigiden Gameplaykorsetts stößt und sich selbst sabotiert, indem es sich weigert, sich mit der Handlung zu verändern.
Und somit muss ich leider sagen....Verdammt schade um das Potenzial.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971965320', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1439127644}
review: "Here is my politics. Here is a choose your own adventure between the soapboxing. There goes the enjoyment I get out of gaming. Here comes the refund."

author: {'steamid': '76561198032518991', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1440240919}
review:
Having recently read about Chile, Allente and Pinochet -events that in my opinion are clearly referenced throughout the story- I found this game very moving. But then again revolutions always move me.

I loved the art, and the references to known works of art in combination with the political discussions and the discussions and comments about socioeconomic disparities that tie in with art, the collection of art and it's appreciation. I loved Angela, who at times reminded me of course of Angela Davis, and the complexity of her thoughts and emotions. This game made me think and feel, and this is the most that I can ask from a piece of art.

If you liked Gone Home, you will most likely love this. If you've played other Tale of Tales games and enjoyed them, you will probably enjoy this one too. It doesn't take long to see if this is your cup of tea or not. Play an hour of this, or watch the first 30 minutes of a walkthrough and it'll be easy to see if this game is for you. Many people didn't like it, the fist 10 or so most helpful reviews here on Steam are negative, which is why I felt the need to write my thoughts and give it a thumbs up.

Tale of Tales has come a long way since The Path. They finally found the best recipe for a balanced interactive experience. This is trully an art game. It saddens me that the commercial failure of Sunset brought the studio to its knees and almost to its end. I don't always love Tale of Tales games, but I appreciate that they exist and create new things that no other studio does. I think videogames as a medium and in order to progress, NEED minds like Auriea Harvey and Michaël Samyn to imagine them in new, unconventional ways. It's because of this need that their games have influenced many people, even if they never had a commercial success of their own.

It makes me feel hopeless that ToT, a studio we need, might close because their best game, and a really good one at that, didn't sell enough. Sunset achieves everything it sets out to do. Whether you enjoy this is up to your personal preferences, but it is excellent in its construction (even if the controlls when chosing between the orange and blue options are a bit wonky).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998412992', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1439057473}
review:
In Sunset you play Angela Burns, an American living in a fictional Latin American country under an oppressive regime. Angela is the housekeeper for Gabriel, a powerful man in the government. Though the backdrop of civil unrest and revolution is potentially interesting, the game itself often isn't.

Each day you take an elevator up to the posh penthouse. While Angela narrates some thoughts you are presented with the list of tasks to do, though you can do more (or less) if you'd like. The main mechanic of the game, is that you can perform tasks warmly or coldly. How you perform these actions affects your relationship with your absent employer. I didn't even notice there were options on how to perform tasks until a few days in. Then all of a sudden, after choosing to paint a wall red instead of blue, leaving some lights on, and moving some slippers, Angela and Gabriel were on the cusp of a romantic relationship.

The idea of romancing your boss, especially given the nature of the working relationship, wasn't one I was entirely comfortable with. The fact that Gabriel wasn't even present in the game, and Angela never met him, made it even more strange. However, once I was started, I continued down the romantic path to see where it went. After a while, Angela and Gabriel start communicating via notes left around the apartment, though the content of these notes don't seem to affect Angela's narration of the world events.

Sunset started out on rocky terrain by making the gameplay about housekeeping. That's not really something I want to do in my own apartment, never mind choosing to pretend to do it in a video game. The story isn't strong enough to make up for this. It takes a long time for anything interesting to happen. Days and days went by before the gameplay started integrating into the story of civil war. About an hour in, I was quite bored. Eventually, some interesting tidbits of information start appearing, but they were spread so thinly throughout the game.

The game isn't completely without charms. The voice acting is good, the music is great, and I enjoyed the increasing focus on art in the latter parts of the game. But it's just not enough. There are good things in this game, they are few and far between. Had the game been 2 hours instead of 4, I think some of the issues could have been solved, but as it is, Sunset just wasn't an engaging experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970951366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1438576244}
review:
Sunset is a very powerful interactive experience!  It's rare that I'm moved by a narrative anymore, but this game is one that has really made me feel a lot of things, and will stick with me for a long time.

I do need to point out that even on a fairly powerful machine, the performance of this game was pretty bad at times.  Thankfully the pace is slow enough it really didn't detract from the experience, but clearly the developer could do a lot more optimization for future updates/games.  I susupect these issues came from doing dynamic lighting in Unity 4.x, where as Unity 5.x handles these things so much better now.  Also, strangely the graphics vary from sometimes looking gorgeous and stylized to other times looking muzzy and washed out.  But stick with the game... it's totally worth playing even with these technical issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984536710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1442776323}
review:
History is often made by the actions of  kings, presidents and dictators who act in accordance with their ideologies or their ambitions. They rule above the clouds, pretending to be gods, as they play their horrible wars and sordid plans. 
Sunset gives voice to an educated  and intelligent woman, who happens to be the janitor of a rich appartment, in a very poor country, during an undeclared civil war. It is an intimate and intense experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028995401', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1438388436}
review: This is an interactive narrative. I've seen many people complaining about the "gameplay." If you go in expecting anything more than a walking simulator with a great story, you're going to be disappointed. Think of this game as Gone Home with choices. Things you do in this game certainly affect the outcome and that, in a way, is the point of the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019337704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1438322722}
review: The game does not work as a character study or a look at the lives of innocents caught up in war. Everything that happens is simply told to the player by Angela without any direct experience of how San Bavon is reacting to the conflict. It is dull, unengaging, and pretentious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043449892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1437526803}
review: The worst part about this game is the price, that was the real killer. If it was around $5.00 or so, then I could see investing a little time in it. The game is exactly what it says it is, a walking simulator. That can work in some cases if the story is intresting enough or the interactions in the world around you are unique. Sunset, however, lacks both. It takes far too long to get invested in any actual story/drama, The interface is choppy and annoying, there is no real goal set up (that is to say, no end in sight), and to top it all off its grossly overpriced. Don't buy this game, or at least wait for it to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028179042', 'num_games_owned': 5929, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1437247068}
review:
Cuando jugué a Dear Esther me quedé con las ganas de poder interacturar un poquito más con el entorno y poder afectar a la historia, era todo muy bonito y daban ganas de explorarlo pero a veces daba la sensación de que era todo pintado en cartón piedra y que estaba dentro de una película obligado a seguir un guión. Cuando vi Joe's Dinner pensé que había encontrado lo que buscaba, vale que la temática de terror no me atraía nada pero al ver unos minutos del juego y leer varias reseñas me di cuenta que lo habían hecho mal.

Pues llegamos a que me encuentro un humble bundle weekly la mar de raro, porque el juntar juegos porque su protagonista es femenina tiene mérito... Algunos los tenía pero la mayoría eran el tipo de juego que me gustan, no suelo llegar al Tier 3 pero al ver los vídeos/trailers me quedé patidifuso:
¿Un juego más bien narrativo cuya temática se centra en el espionaje (o algo así) y el romance? Toma todo mi dinero...

Vale, ha llegado el momento de salir del armario, sé que con lo que voy a decir voy a perder todo el respeto que alguien me pudiera tener en esta comunidad virtual: me gustan las pelis románticas, principalmente las comedias. A otros les ponen los animales... Yo aún creo que en las relaciones sentimentales puede haber algo de magia (pasión y romance) más allá del sexo y me divierten ese tipo de historias... Además en los videojuegos suelen llevar a decisiones con consecuencias inesperadas e imprevisibles.

Ahora tengo que distraer vuestra atención: Sí, Sunset es lo que parece el Chacha Simulator 2015. Tomas el rol de una afroamericana que pese a sus estudios universitarios decide a principios de los 70s coger un trabajo de "ama de llaves" y tiene que pasar una vez por semana a limpiar durante una hora un duplex de un hispano al que le sobra el dinero y al que nunca ve, todo esto en una isla de una república bananera. ¿Interesante, eh? Si con esto te he vendido el juego, tienes un problema... Que lo sepas.

Obviamente el trabajo de "ama de llaves" es una excusa para mandarte hacer una serie de tareas y poner límites a lo que puedes hacer. Llega un momento en que limpiar es lo de menos y eres la "chica de los recados": pintar paredes, reparar estatuas, decorar, escribir... Vamos como las tareas que te mandarían en cualquier MMO pero más variadas y sin caminar tanto.

La gracia es que esa hora semanal es una media hora de tiempo real y el realizar tareas consume tiempo, con lo que muchas veces apenas tendrás tiempo de hacer los encargos y poquita cosilla más... Si te aburres te puedes ir y darlo por terminado, incluso aunque no hayas cumplido las tareas en la lista de ese día.

¿Y qué más quiero hacer? Pues por desgracia tienes muchas opciones y probablemente las quieras hacer todas y te falte tiempo [spoiler](por suerte hay un bug que si sales del juego te guarda lo que hayas hecho pero reinicia el tiempo, así se puede hacer casi todo en un solo playthrough con paciencia)[/spoiler]. La protagonista gusta de escribir sus pensamientos en un diario, y lo escribe siempre en el mismo sofá (que el dueño de la casa suele cambiar cada poco de sitio para hacerlo entretenido) y escribe horriblemente lento (luego hablaré de eso) y sobretodo vas a querer explorar. Además de las tramas principales subyacentes que he dejado caer al principio (romance y espionaje) el juego tiene 100 logros y casi todos son recompensas a la exploración: encontrar libros o discos o hacer ciertas acciones que no son necesarias para la trama principal pero que dan color al juego.

¿Y cómo puede haber una trama romántica si no se ven? Pues como buena relación a distancia en plan Lady Halcón, dejándose notitas o haciendo las cosas con "un toque personal". La mayoría de las acciones tienen dos opciones: la más cálida y personal (el típico hacerlo con cariño) o la más fría y profesional, se supone que cuantas más veces elijas la cálida (naranja) más se estrecha la relación con el dueño de la casa, pero habrá momentos que preferirás la azul (que no solo es la fría, también suele estar relacionada con agresividad y venganza). Otras acciones simplemente tienen una opción pero lo que marca la diferencia es hacerlas o no.

Excepto una parte del juego donde decidieron limitar la mecánica para dar más vía libre al jugador y reducir los cambios [spoiler](durante una temporada que el dueño está en el extranjero solo se abre una habitación automáticamente y apenas cambian las cosas de sitio, lo que limita tanto las acciones como la exploración)[/spoiler], durante el resto del juego te darás cuenta que estás en un entorno que conoces (la distribución del duplex no cambia) pero durante la semana las cosas cambiarán de sitio, aparecerán nuevas cosas y podrás ir sabiendo más del dueño de la casa, y la fecha importa.

El juego se puede acabar en unas 4 o 5 horas, menos si vas a toda prisa, pero ese tiempo es el necesario para tomarlo con calma e ir disfrutando y explorando. Yo lo he acabado 4 veces para conseguir el 100% de los logros. Una vez que acabas puedes volver a empezar para "rellenar los huecos", te conserva lo que has hecho pero puedes hacer otras cosas que se te despistaran o no te diera tiempo. Si quieres cambiar las elecciones tienes la posibilidad de resetearlo.

Gráficamente y en cuanto a música es espectácular, hay gente que se queja del rendimiento debido a los reflejos, yo tengo una máquina que podemos llamar de "nueva generación" (pensada para poder jugar los ports de PS4 a ultra) y no he tenido problemas. Lo que si he echado de menos es un par de inconsistencias a nivel de gameplay. Hay ciertas acciones (las supuestamente más personales) que en vez de consumir tiempo las hace en tiempo real: escribir en el diario o [spoiler]aprender a tocar el piano[/spoiler] y es un verdadero coñazo... Tú quieres hacerla, por completismo, por el logro, por saber que pasa... Pero tener que esperar mirando a la pantalla como tonto mientras la hace es un peñazo, yo creo que les falta un minijuego que la haga más llevadera o al menos una opción de abreviarla igual que cuando te saltas una cinemática.

Hay dos finales y es muy fácil saber como alcanzarlos y en que se diferencian, pero no estoy convencido hasta que punto dependen de todas las decisiones o de una concreta y la verdad es que prefiero no saberlo.

El juego tiene una tremenda crítica social, habla de varios temas y a veces cae incluso pesado: discriminación racial, discriminación de la mujer, libertad, el imperialismo yanqui, corrupción, abuso de poder... Por suerte se reduce obviando el diario, pero se supone que es una parte importante de la experiencia de juego.

Tiene un par de bugs menores. Aparte del que comenté de poder resetear el tiempo en una jornada, puedes ver a través del telescopio aunque estén las persianas echadas (eso sí con el ratón, porque olvidaron que se pudiera usar con el pad). Si tocas el teclado pierdes el movimiento vertical en el pad hasta que vuelves a ir al ascensor y volver... Se me ha cerrado un par de veces por un error gráfico pero me temo que es algo de mis drivers porque me ha pasado con otros juegos, por suerte Sunset guarda muy bien los avances y las pérdidas fueron mínimas.

A mi me ha gustado mucho pero entiendo que haya sido un batacazo para la desarrolladora que esperaban un bestseller a la altura de Gone Home (que es difícil explicarse su éxito) y apostaron demasiado en ello.

La banda sonora es principalmente orquestal y con canciones de los discos para dar ambiente al juego, si alguien tiene realmente interés: https://austinwintory.bandcamp.com/album/sunset

En resumen: es un juego diferente con unas mecánicas diferentes, donde es importante la gestión del tiempo, se premia la exploración y da la oportunidad de investigar varias tramas, además de que da una fuerte sensación de que nuestras decisiones, incluso las más pequeñas importan y tienen impacto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025146480', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1437136369}
review:
Ok first things first: If you don't like games where there is not a lot of conflict or action, this game isn't for you. I feel like I need to get that out there. There's a pretty large group of people on here that this game won't appeal to. It's artsy and filled with long sections of sitting on a chair watching text scroll past. Also the game runs pretty poorly so definitely not recommended if you don't have a decent PC.

That being said, I liked it. It begins with an interesting concept: You are a maid, cleaning the house of a famous art collector, during a revolution in the fictional South American country, Anchuria. You have one (ingame) hour to look around the house before sunset and find out as much as you can. 

What follows is war, love, art, hypocrisy, nostalgia and anger. which I must say is pretty impressive considering most of this story is told through small bits of dialogues and diary entries. 

The writing is pretty great although it is sometimes held back by the format. It's hard to feel any sort of urgency when everything happens offscreen. Things happen but you never really get to see any of it because it all takes place inside this one house. 

The diary entries are pretty long and I take issue with the fact that you can't scroll through it and read at your own pace, but these end up being the games best feature. At least, I played it a couple of days ago and I'm still thinking about what makes this character tick. This is basically the reason I would recommend it. 

As for the other production values, the game has a nice aesthetic and the music is fantastic. So points for that as well. 

However, there's some more little issues that I have with the game, mostly in the fact that the game time is padded pretty significantly, overstaying its welcome a little bit. 

There's also the issue of the price tag. I got this in a Humble Bundle so it wasn't much of an issue but it's only 5 hours long and a lot of that is pretty much the same thing, so I can't justify the £15 pricetag, even though I know what the company has now dealt with.

So yeah, if it goes on sale, buy this. It's worth a shot, even if it's just because it has some things that are really interesting in it's core.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064297907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1433254315}
review:
Sunset follows in Bioshock Infinite's footsteps in that it explores racism, religion, philosophy, revolution, and even culture. Except unlike Bioshock Infinite, Sunset never fails to handle the subject matter with grace, nuance, and beautiful clarity. 9.0/10

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gZXjPkJvrRw

author: {'steamid': '76561198157858388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1437115122}
review:
This game could have been better if the pacing was faster. I felt the story literally dragging me along each time I was supposed to enter the apartment. I like the story telling mechanics, but I was disappointed that we didn't see more of the regime effecting the world around the apartment. I couldn't truly feel for the characters because the protagonist merely "described" what was happening. I think this game could have showed more of what was happening than rely solely on the descriptions of the protagonist. 

Overall, this game is really repetitive, but has a great story. I wouldn't recommend it simply because I was getting bored of the protagonist telling me what was happening with the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053494370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1436998997}
review: "No no mr Petter no here" simulator 2015

author: {'steamid': '76561198036024993', 'num_games_owned': 2619, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1436434546}
review:
This game is awesome. It is beatiful. It is calm. Makes you think and lets your mind wander.

You literally are a housekeeper and do housekeeper work by walking around in a large flat.  It is the story about a military coup in the background that evolves and keeps you interested - also a sort of love story starts.

From a technical standpoint it is not very polished and requires quite some Ooompf for the actual graphics you'll see.

Anyhow.

If you are mostly into AAA titles, you might be totally bored. On the other hand, if you are interested in alternative and creative new concepts (do you like the sundance festival?), go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129472034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1561326097}
review:
Worst cleaning sim ever! (But my favorite story driven point and click)

This is a point and click with a deep story (and no stupid "find these 12 objects" mini games) that takes roughly 4-6 hours to play through. 

A fictitious South American country set in the 1970s is in the beginning stages of a revolution. A well educated maid never meets the powerful man whose apartment she cleans, but she gets to know him through his activities, notes, and belongings. She subtley changes his mind about the current events, and helps change the future of her country.

I'm playing my second play through now. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971531807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1432241849}
review: A game that is not for all the people, but I like it. Is a bit like "Papers Please meets Gone Home", because your behaviour has influence in the "real" world outside your zone, but in first person, and by playing you know better other character. I really like it, but is a difficult game to enter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970262379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1436576079}
review:
This is a thought provoking, slow burn of a game set in one location.  Despite the use of a single level, there is enough variety to reward exploration.  The wonderful soundtrack also helps in setting the mood.   Definitely play it on a summers evening with the sun low in the sky for maximum effect.

On the technical side, there are some performance issues, but the devs have provided lots of options to tweak with.   My only beef is with the selection mechanic as the interface seems to steer you to particular choices over others.

In short, I enjoyed the game, despite some initial reservations.  From the looks of the achievement list, it may be worth replaying for some alternate paths through the storyline.

Story Tip: persist with the diary entries in the latter stages of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980280854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1436743919}
review:
Beautiful, poignant, and introspective.  If you liked Gone Home, or Dear Esther, I strongly recommend Sunset.  The game's story is told from a unique perspective, one most usually dismiss or deride.  This is not a power fantasy.  It's about one person doing the best she can in a difficult situation.  She has little power or agency, yet the ways in which you are able to influence the world still feels satisfying.

One last note, make sure you try to end the day with finding the white-draped chair and sitting in it. You'll get snippets of Angela's journal. I didn't discover this until halfway through, and I'm looking forward to playing through again to try and read all the journals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092660310', 'num_games_owned': 2279, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1660612876}
review:
I'm sorry for everyone who gives this game a quick negative review about being a Gone Home clone, walking simulator or simply for doing tasks.

None of it is true.

But I do understand how this game is not for everyone, it's an experience you have to be willing to fully dive into. It's an emotional adventure for eyes, ears and mind.
Too bad it suffers the fate of many epic female protagonist games, that it gets easily despised by mainstream gamers.

The story is great, the character interaction (yes, you can absolutely call it like that) is beautiful, there's replay value, you can just sit around, do nothing and listen to the music for half an hour and it wouldn't be wasted.

This game is a gift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121693259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1436197952}
review:
仅作玩后感并纪念宣布关闭的Tale of Tales工作室.

时间总令人产生莫名的敬畏感, 当你每天花一个小时去做家务, 日复一日, 你总会毫无理由的爱上一个地方, 或者一个人。

Sunset就是一部用时间冲刷你的社会实践和体验作品, 你作为Angela, 一个非裔女佣, 根据本子上的需求记录，在每天日落前做一小时的家务, 随着房间和窗外因为战争而发生的变化, Angela从侧面体验着一场逐步接近的神秘战争, 什么时候外面又炸弹爆炸了? 什么时候哪儿又传来了枪声? 好像什么时候直升机正从头顶飞过? 但因为一扇窗, 将战争和Angela隔开, 她只能在有限的空间里去体验和发掘, 作为玩家, 你能逐渐发掘Angela和雇主似有似无的的关系, 以及角色的内心世界。

Angela在测试自己, 发掘自我, 整部作品没有任何NPC交互, 只有玩家操控的黑人女佣独自一人, 她做出的只有小决定, 小选择, 无伤大局, 也就是说对整场神秘的战争毫无影响, 你可以选择完美完成每天的家务活儿, 或者部分完成, 甚至随便走几步就进入电梯离开这个破地方, 这部作品正是一部实验艺术, 测试你在战争时期的一个小角落里, 你到底是一个安分守己的普通人, 还是一个混饭吃的叛徒, 或者你极有可能是雇主的挚友, 但挚友这点YY的观点至少现在我还没有确凿的体验。

Angela日复一日的辛苦劳作, 在她眼前是金钱和艺术, 随着时间的推移, 由金钱堆砌的家具, 高档设备和艺术品也被战争影响, 破碎, 倾斜, 倒塌, 直到有一天没有了光, 什么都没有了。

整部作品你只有在玻璃的反射中能才见到Angela的面容, 大部分时候你并不会发现有什么亮点,  她仅仅是一个穿着朴素相貌平平的路人女子, 但有极少时候你能发现她穿着漂亮的衣服和高跟鞋, 这或许是在暗示她也渴望突破自我? 她需要自由? 我觉得这只是为自己的YY罢了, 在这样一部实验艺术作品中, 很难定义什么是对, 什么是错? 这就是所谓灭绝人性的艺术吧, 玩家能体验到一种奇异的存在感, 你有足够的理由去做出各种决定, 顺着提示, 违背设计, 你也有足够的理由去抵制那日复一日无趣的家务, 最终Angela变成了你, 你变成了小白鼠。

游戏整体美术风格偏现代主义, 有时刺眼的阳光导致整个画面模糊又粗糙, 总觉得暗喻着什么? 场景里的名画和随机出现的文学作品或许也让作品的B格暴增, 作为文学和艺术爱好者, 也许会对这样的互动体验作品更加好奇, 当我玩到N天之后, 在二楼楼梯口发现了一本The Edge of Vision, 居然能发现这种B格的讲抽象摄影历史的书, 我整个人都快不好了, 瞬间觉得自己太low, 没资格玩这种高雅的互动艺术作品, 整部游戏的配乐也显出各种B格, 古典,交响,酸性爵士, 在玩儿完后的credits里才发现配乐是Journey的编曲Austin Wintory, 总之从某种意义上说, Sunset可以算作一部纯艺术作品。

三个多小时, 我居然就走到终点, 面对一面被炸开的墙, 伴随着突然出现的制作人员名单, 墙外是一片茂密的森林, 这又是什么鬼？真是令人深思, 瞬间脑补到王小帅《闯入者》结尾男孩跳楼后那扇孤独的破窗, 那种虐心的孤寂感, 仿佛又有希望看到什么? 我不敢多想, 同时面对还剩80多个未解锁成就, tale of tales你不能关闭啊! 求给我一个答案!

第一人称, 有的时候镜头晃的过快, 还总觉得胃部不适, 我或许是太急于找到答案了。

我决定再扎回游戏, 回味这部以游戏作为媒介的实验艺术作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1436121387}
review:
Je dois vous avouer qu'incarner une femme de ménage dans un pays d'Amérique du Sud n'est pas quelque chose qui m'excite spécialement dit comme ça. 

Sunset avait tout du jeu indé prétentieux où on passe son temps à marcher et à subir une mise en scène sans ambition. C'est le cas. On passe bien son temps à nettoyer et ranger, seul dans le même appartement, mais je n'ai pas pu décrocher avant la fin.

La relation entre la femme de ménage et son employeur (qu'on ne voit jamais) est franchement bien vue, puisque tout se fait par le biais de petits mots, signes ou attentions. On finit par s'attacher à cet appartement, à cet homme qu'on ne connait qu'au travers de son environnement et de ses objets personnels. Le contexte politique occupe également une grande place dans le jeu et il vous suffira d'écouter la radio ou de simplement regarder par la fenêtre pour vous en appercevoir. Et même qu'à un moment, il se passe quelque chose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002360985', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1439076015}
review:
Tale of Talesが制作したゲームは、ゲームとして楽しむより、ゲームという形式を使った作品で「味わう」ものが多いと思うが、今回もそれをはっきりと見せている。

　ゲームとしては、プレイヤーは家政婦として、依頼主の住む高級マンションの部屋で仕事をこなすというもの。依頼の内容は「ダイニングを掃除しといて」「ベッドメイキングして」などだが、「ダイニングはどこ？ベッドは？」など、どこにあるか探さないといけない。
　勤務は17時～18時の1時間、タイトルのSunset（夕暮れ時）はそこから来ている。

　1日の勤務が過ぎたらまた次、また次と、それが淡々と続くので、間取りを把握してスムーズに進めるようになるが、その依頼を毎回ちゃんとこなすか、そこで「ベッドは普通にメイキングする？自分なりのアレンジをする？」という選択、依頼以外のことをする、毎回どこかに依頼者のメモ書きがあるが、それに2択でどう返事を書くか選んでいくと、変化があるらしい。私が見たのは、依頼者が荒れて部屋が滅茶苦茶になったり、外のビルで火災があるなど。

　場所はあまりに限られているが、依頼内容や置かれているオブジェクトは毎回違っているところに、姿を一切見せない依頼主の性格や生活感が見えたり、100もある実績を見つけ出すなど、探ることと、その空間を味わうことが、このゲームの面白さだと思う。

　だが、まず「これは何をするゲーム？」が、1時間ほど続けてようやく分かったり、その後も変化が少なく延々部屋で散策を続けさせられるという難がある、言葉が重要なゲームだが、英語ではほとんど理解できなくて悔しい思いをするなど、作品を味わう前に挫折してしまいやすい。

　このメーカーの味が好きな人は、ここでも感じることができると思うが、そのためには根気が必要だし、実際に触れて味わってからでないと伝わらない。
　この意味でも、Tale of Talesらしさがあると言えるかもしれない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198078993075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1435971413}
review:
This is an intelligent, tension building game. The colors and atmosphere were amazing. The voice acting was skillful. There is no direct death/killing (bonus for me), but it did have several moral quandries around causing death to others (double bonus as I enjoy moral quandries.) I loved the little details and might play through again for the side things I didn't discover until far into the game.

On the down side, I'm not really sure what happened at the end. The credits rolled and I kinda went 'What?!" I wonder if it will become more clear on subsequent playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998793899', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1435515395}
review:
Krieg, Gewalt, Diktatur, Einschüchterung, Machtüberfluss und Machtlosigkeit.

Das sind alles Themen, welche immer wieder in den Mittelpunkt stehen. Geschichten, die sich immer wiederholen. Trotz den daraus gezogenen Erfahrungen. Tagtäglich. Auf unserer kleinen Kugel, auf die wir unseren Alltag verrichten.
Videospiele haben schon einige Versuche unternommen, die oben genannten Themen so authentisch wie möglich zu veranschaulichen. In den häufigsten Fällen durch das Mitendrinn-Gefühl, indem wir die Rolle eines Soldaten oder einer Person mit einem übermenschlichen Tatendrang einnehmen.
Doch wie sieht es aus, wenn man mal keinen Soldaten spielt? Wie fühlt es sich an, wenn man selber nicht mit der Waffe schiesst, sondern die Rolle eines Zivilisten einnimmt? Was für Gedanken, Sorgen und Gefühle hat man während einer solchen Zeit?

Sunset beantwortet diese Fragen.
Die Art und Weise, wie es diese Fragen jedoch beantwortet, ist ein zweischneidiges Schwert.

Denn wer die anderen „Tale of Tales“-Spiele kennt, wird wahrscheinlich jetzt schon wissen, dass man „Sunset“ nicht einfach mal so schnell nebenbei spielen kann.
Es braucht eine sehr  grosse freiwillige Bereitschaft, sich in ein Erlebnis einzulassen, bei dem Spass nicht im Vordergrund steht. Und es nimmt sich sehr viel Zeit, bis es an Fahrt aufgenommen hat.
Sehr viel Zeit.

Wenn man sich die anderen Reviews über das Spiel durchliest, wird man merken, dass die meisten Spieler sich über exakt diese beiden Punkten beklagen. Und ich kann nicht genug betonen, dass das Spiel nicht für jeden Spielertyp gemacht worden ist. Im Gegenteil. Es wird nur einen sehr kleinen Teil ansprechen.
Doch finde ich es persönlich keine schlechte Entscheidung. Auch wenn ich zugeben muss, dass sich die Erfahrung  zwischendurch ziemlich langgezogen angefühlt hat und es einige technische Defizite (Bugs, Ruckler) beinhaltet, sass bei mir der bleibende Eindruck am Schluss tief!
Denn der authentische Soundtrack, das interessante 70er Jahre Setting, die gut geschriebenen Monologe und das wunderschöne Tagebuch der Hauptprotagonistin, indem ihre Charakterzüge, Sorgen und Gedanken so klar wie in keinem anderen Spiel ausgedrückt werden, haben mich immer wieder daran erinnert, warum ich mich in das Erlebnis einlassen wollte.

Und freilich das Hauptthema: Gewalt und Krieg.
Ich kenne kein anderes Spiel, welches die beiden Themen so indirekt und trotzdem unglaublich beunruhigend präsentiert.
Man ist nicht vor Ort dabei. Man sieht nicht, welche oder wie viele Menschen dabei sterben.
Das Einzige, was man hört, sind die Schüsse, Explosionen und die Sirenen. Und das Einzige, was man sieht, ist der schwarze Rauch, welcher nach einer Explosion gen Himmel emporsteigt.
Die Tatsache, dass die Ortschaft, indem gerade langsam ein Krieg aufblüht, eigentlich ein Paradies war, macht die Sache dann noch unangenehmer und trauriger.
In all diesem Chaos hat man aber Kontakt zu einer Person, welcher man nie persönlich trifft, jedoch die Lösung zu all diesen Problemen sein könnte. Und vielleicht sogar die Lösung zu all den persönlichen Ängsten und Sorgen, welche die Hauptprotagonistin in sich trägt.
Sofern man ihn dazu eine Chance lassen möchte.
Und das alles hat mich zum Nachdenken erregt…

Wenn man erstmal soweit ist, dass man sich darüber Gedanken macht, warum man Krieg führt, warum es Gewalt überhaupt gibt, warum jemand eine rücksichtslose Diktatur nacheifert, ab wann jemand ein Held ist, wo und wann Liebe „Sinn macht“….

Wenn man erstmal soweit ist, dann hat man das Spiel verstanden.

Denn es ist nicht dazu da, diese Fragen zu beantworten.
Es ist dazu da, dass man sich diese Fragen selber stellt. Dass man aufmerksam wird.

[u]Und deswegen ziehe ich meinen Hut vor diesem Spiel.[u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971158755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1435931685}
review:
There are brief moments of clarity, insight, and humanity in this that mark the experience as worthwhile. The game is smart (as in, smartly written, and almost spare in its approach to interaction) but it doesn't bludgeon you around the head with its erudition (I'm looking at you, Talos Principle...)

There are very clear nods to ideas and discussions that someone with an elaborately useless fine arts / humanties background would appreciate. And there are games that are played with the interface and the ideas of video-game conventions - the checklist, the arbitrary timer, the old modus of hunt-click-interact that we've been trained on since we were tiny little half-formed gamesters flinging cursors around the pocket-pixels of old Lucas-Arts adventures. 

But it never rubs your face in it. There's a set of simple tasks, and then those that are hidden - implied. Big questions, that might not gel with your own politics. Hey - what of it? Play through the character. Try to get inside her head - work through this little fragmentary window - filtered through genre conventions and cliche and bias...

If we only watched the films that made us comfortable - if we only read literature we agreed with - we'd be lesser for it. Same for games. 

This is a worthwhile game. This is... interesting... despite its flaws. And it's... engrossing. It took about four hours of my evening without my even realising - just flicking through - day to day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017279626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1435924823}
review: If you like Dear Ester and Gone Home, you would most probably like this.  It's a narration game like Dear Ester with some additional interactions and scheduling thrown in.  There is some interesting drama and a nice story.  It's simply another narrative game, in this particular genre.  No better or worse than any other, but the story is good and has a decent presentation so I give it a thumbs up.
